firstRun.title: First steps after installation
firstRun.subtitle: PWRX is ready. Start with profile basics and your first import.
firstRun.step1Body: Set at least body weight and optionally FTP in Settings. This improves W/kg, power and training analysis.
firstRun.step1HintOptionalFtp: Tip: FTP is optional, but improves power zones and training load calculations.
firstRun.step2Body: Import FIT/GPX/TCX files or a complete Strava export ZIP. For Strava exports, activities.csv and ZIP import help with names and gear mapping.
firstRun.step3Body: Create bikes/shoes manually or use automatic import from a Strava export. Afterwards you can assign gear to activities.
firstRun.step4Body: Once data is imported, start on the dashboard and drill into Power, Training and Segments.

sync.title: Sync activities from Strava
sync.runningBody: Data is being imported in the background and will appear gradually.
sync.runningSettingsHint: Please enter your personal data in Settings.
sync.successBody: Activities are syncing in the background

error.title: Failed to load
error.message: The data could not be loaded. Please try again.

activities.title: No activities found
activities.description: There are no activities for the selected filters. Try a different range or remove some filters.

data.title: No data available
data.description: There is no data for this period.

footer.poweredBy: PWRX ‚Äî Power Explorer for Training Data

list.title: Segments
list.subtitle: Overview and leaderboards of your segments.

detail.previewSubtitle: Snapshot from a reference activity on this segment.
detail.previewUnavailable: No sufficient stream data is currently available for this segment.
detail.timelineFallback: Range too narrow - showing all efforts.
detail.timelineEmpty: You need multiple efforts on this segment to see a trend.

rename.autoHint: Custom rename disables automatic renaming for this segment.

delete.confirm: Do you really want to delete imported activity "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

segments.title: Segments
segments.empty: No segment data yet. Backfill is running or hasn't started.

manual.hint: Tip: drag in the elevation chart, then fine-tune start/end with the +/- controls.
manual.mapTitle: Route map with live segment focus
manual.mapHint: When a range is selected, the map highlights and zooms into start/end points.

preview.title: Segment preview: {{name}}
preview.subtitle: Map excerpt and elevation profile for the selected segment.
preview.elevationEmpty: No elevation data available for this segment.

charts.selectRange: Drag in the chart to mark a range.

trainingStimulus.title: Training stimulus
trainingStimulus.noFtp: FTP missing - training stimulus cannot be calculated.
trainingStimulus.basedOn: Based on FTP, normalized power, and duration.

powerZones.title: Power Zones
powerZones.subtitle: Power zones
powerZones.noFtp: FTP not set - zones are calculated after you add FTP.

gear.title: Gear
gear.noGear: No gear available yet. Create bike/shoes first on the gear page.
gear.assignError: Failed to assign gear to activity.

localClimbs.title: Local Segments
localClimbs.subtitle: Manage auto-detected segments from configured activity sources.

categoryGuide.title: Segment categories
categoryGuide.subtitle: How local segment difficulty is graded.
categoryGuide.scale: Scale: HC (hardest), Cat 1, Cat 2, Cat 3, Cat 4 (classic race style), plus Cat 5 and Cat 6 for shorter/easier segments.

backfill.title: Backfill local segments
backfill.subtitle: Runs segment detection in bulk for sources and sport types enabled in settings.

noData.timeOfDay: No time of day data available

hrZones.title: Heart Rate Zones
hrZones.subtitle: Time distribution across HR zones (last {{months}} months)

trainingLoad.requiredBody: Set your FTP on the Power page to see Training Stress Score (TSS) analysis with CTL, ATL, and TSB.
trainingLoad.title: Training Load (Last {{days}} Days)
trainingLoad.subtitle: Normalized Power, Intensity Factor, and Training Stress Score

weekday.title: Weekdays
weekday.subtitle: Which weekdays do you train the most?

timeOfDay.title: Time of day
timeOfDay.subtitle: When do you prefer to train?

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Manage your profile and training settings

connection.sourceHint: These connection details come from the active Strava sync/adapter.
connection.hiddenHint: Strava sync is disabled. Strava connection details are hidden.

localClimbs.title: Local segment detection
localClimbs.hint: Controls which activities are included when backfilling local segments.
localClimbs.namingHint: Optional naming logic for local segments. When enabled, reverse geocoding adds a street/place hint.
localClimbs.virtualNamePreferred: Prefer activity name for virtual activities

advanced.title: Advanced
advanced.hint: Technical reverse-geocoding options. Defaults are sufficient for normal usage.

descriptions.includeImported: Include activities from file imports (.fit/.fit.gz/.gpx/.gpx.gz/.tcx/.tcx.gz/.zip) in local segment detection.
descriptions.includeStrava: Include activities loaded via Strava sync.
descriptions.includeRide: Detect local segments in ride activities.
descriptions.includeRun: Detect local segments in run activities.
descriptions.reverseGeocodeEnabled: Adds location or street context to segment names using coordinates.
descriptions.virtualNamePreferred: For virtual rides/runs, prefer the activity name over geographic naming.
descriptions.reverseGeocodeUrl: API endpoint used for reverse geocoding (default: Nominatim).
descriptions.reverseGeocodeLanguage: Preferred language(s) for place names, e.g. de,en.
descriptions.reverseGeocodeUserAgent: App identifier sent with geocoding requests; required by some providers.
descriptions.reverseGeocodeTimeoutMs: Maximum wait time per reverse geocoding request in milliseconds.

rename.title: Rename existing local segments
rename.hint: Applies the current naming logic to existing local segments.

jobs.title: Segment jobs (tech)
jobs.subtitle: Operational segment jobs for backfill and targeted rebuilds.

rebuild.title: Rebuild single activity
rebuild.invalidActivityId: Please enter a valid activity ID.

repairSportTypes.title: Repair malformed activity sport types
repairSportTypes.hint: Fixes older file imports with malformed sport types (for example text/html) after parser fixes. Intended for self-hosted maintenance.

toast.errorBody: Failed to repair malformed sport types.

sync.title: Sync
sync.scheduleHint: Auto sync runs daily at the selected time. Catch-up runs after startup if a sync was missed.

manual.title: Manual sync
manual.subtitle: Run a full sync immediately (activities, segments, photos).
manual.activityDesc: Runs the same sync as the schedule.
manual.alreadyRunning: A sync is already running. Please wait until it finishes.
manual.backfillDesc: Fills missing streams, segments, and photos for older activities (limited per run).
manual.explainActivity: Activity sync uses the recent-days window and is best for new activities.
manual.explainBackfill: Backfill sync is for older data gaps and respects the backfill limits.

toast.successBody: The job is running in the background. Check Logs for progress.
toast.alreadyRunningBody: Please wait for the current sync to finish.
toast.errorBody: Please try again or check your connection.

initial.title: Initial sync
initial.subtitle: One-time onboarding sync for a new user (activities, athlete profile, and gear). You can run it anytime.
initial.hint: Streams and segments follow your activity sync settings and may take time due to Strava rate limits.

sync.simpleHint: Runs once per day at the selected time.
sync.cronHintShort: Advanced schedule with cron. * means every.
sync.cronHint: Cron format: minute hour day month weekday. * means every. Example: 30 3 * * * = 03:30 daily.
sync.onStartupHint: If the device was off, run a catch-up after startup.

syncStatus.title: Sync status
syncStatus.subtitle: Overview of what is synced and what is pending.
syncStatus.tableHint: Counts are per run. Photos = metadata sync from Strava, downloads = local file downloads.

warnings.rateLimit: Strava rate limit reached ‚Äî sync will continue on the next run.
warnings.segmentErrors: {{count}} segment errors (will retry on next run).

errors.API_LIMIT_REACHED: Strava rate limit reached. Please try again later.
errors.AUTH_ERROR: Strava authorization failed. Please reconnect your account.
errors.FORBIDDEN: Strava access denied. Check your app permissions.
errors.STRAVA_ERROR: Strava API unavailable. Please try again later.

users.title: User management
users.subtitle: Manage all Strava accounts in the system
users.athleteIdHelp: You can find the athlete ID in your Strava profile URL

user.alertRequired: Strava athlete ID and refresh token are required
user.confirmDelete: Do you really want to delete user "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

bestEfforts.emptyPower: No power data found. Go to the Power page and click "Generate Power Cache".

mostCalories.description: Activities that burned the most calories

gear.subtitle: Manage and track your bikes and shoes

validation.distanceNonNegative: Distance must be zero or positive.

maintenance.title: Wear tracker
maintenance.subtitle: Set distance limits to get replacement reminders.
maintenance.shoeSetup: Set a distance limit for your shoes.
maintenance.bikeEmpty: No components yet. Add chain, cassette, brakes, etc.

selected.title: Selected activity
selected.empty: Click on a route to see details

yearly.legend: Streams = GPS/HR data | Power = Watt streams for power curve

gaps.photosSyncHint: have photos on Strava but not in our DB
gaps.estimatedPowerHint: no detailed watt stream available from Strava

powerProfile.title: Power Profile
powerProfile.subtitle: Your best power efforts across different durations

cache.notGeneratedHint: Click "Generate Power Cache" above to calculate your power curve data. This may take a few minutes.

riderType.title: Rider type analysis
riderType.subtitle: Based on {{count}} activities with power data

details.title: Details & benchmarks
details.strengthNote: Values ‚â•70% are outstanding. Values between 50‚Äì70% are well developed.
details.benchmarksNote: Benchmarks for trained amateurs to pros. 100% strength = world class level.

sprinter.desc: Sprinters excel at explosive power over very short durations (5‚Äì30s). Ideal for bunch sprints and short steep climbs.

puncheur.desc: Puncheurs specialize in short, explosive attacks (1‚Äì3 min). Perfect for short steep climbs and attacks from the group.

climber.desc: Climbers shine on longer climbs (5‚Äì20 min). High power per kilogram over medium to longer durations.

tt.desc: Time trialists can hold high power steadily for long periods (20‚Äì60 min). Ideal for TTs and steady pace on flat stages.

allrounder.desc: All-rounders have balanced abilities across all durations. Versatile in different race situations.

endurance.desc: Endurance specialists can sustain strong power for long periods (60+ min). Ideal for long steady efforts and breakaways.

types.default: Your profile shows specific strengths. Analyze your values to find your optimal use cases.

yearlyComparison.title: Yearly power curve comparison
yearlyComparison.subtitle: Compare your power profiles across years. Select up to {{count}} years to compare.
yearlyComparison.selectPrompt: Select at least one year to display the power curve
yearlyComparison.note: The X-axis uses a logarithmic scale with higher resolution for short durations (1‚Äì30s) and lower resolution for long durations (up to 3 hours).

yearlyTable.title: Yearly best efforts
yearlyTable.subtitle: Peak power values for each duration by year

keyDurations.title: Key duration comparison
keyDurations.subtitle: Compare peak power at key durations across years

empty.title: No power data
empty.subtitle: No activities with power data found. Power data is typically available from activities recorded with a power meter.

import.title: File Import
import.subtitle: Import FIT, GPX, TCX, or Strava CSV files manually.

stravaExportHint.title: Strava export tip
stravaExportHint.body: For a Strava account export, import activities.csv / activities.csv.gz first (or together with the activity files). This lets PWRX apply activity names and create/assign gear (bike/shoes) from the export. For larger exports you can also upload the full Strava export ZIP below. PWRX will only process activities.csv and activity files from it (optionally images too).
stravaExportHint.uploadSubhint: Large Strava ZIPs are uploaded in chunks and can resume on a new attempt. Server/reverse-proxy limits may still apply. The watch folder remains an optional self-hosted/NAS alternative.
stravaExportHint.includeMedia: Enable media import (images). Images from the Strava export will be linked to imported/existing activities; videos and other media are currently ignored.

errors.completeTimeout: Timeout while finalizing the Strava ZIP import (HTTP 504). The import may still continue in the background. Please check the current import / recent imports list.

progress.processing: Upload complete. Server is filtering the ZIP (relevant Strava files only) and creating the import run...

logs.title: Recent imports
logs.simpleHint: Latest processed imports at a glance.
logs.selectHint: Select an import on the left.
logs.noFiles: No files recorded for this import.

watch.title: Watch folder
watch.subtitle: Automatic import from a configured folder.

config.title: Network share (self-hosted)
config.hint: The watch folder is configured on the server side (Docker/host). Drop import files into the shared folder using Finder/Explorer.
config.copyHint: Note: The folder path is not selected in the browser. PWRX watches the container path; the network path shown here is only the pointer to your file share.

validation.pollSeconds: Scan interval must be between 1 and 3600 seconds.
validation.stableChecks: Stable checks must be between 1 and 20.
validation.pathRequired: A path is required when watch folder is enabled.

watch.enabledNotRunning: Watch folder enabled but not running

queue.title: Queue status
queue.subtitle: Live state of background import jobs.

queueFailed.title: Failed queue jobs
queueFailed.subtitle: Jobs that reached final failed state.

advanced.title: Advanced import tools
advanced.subtitle: Show queue, watch folder, and diagnostics only when needed.
